title: Parameters Report
text:
(code) import libraries & functions
if (!requireNamespace("librarian", quietly = TRUE)) {
  # If not installed, install the package
  install.packages("librarian")
}

librarian::shelf(
  glue,
  quarto
)
source("R/getData.R")



Parameters
Available parameters:


(code) view unique parameters
data <- getData()


New names:
Rows: 612830 Columns: 16
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(10): Source, Site, Latitude, Longitude, Parameter, Value, Units, Trend ... dbl
(6): ...1, Month, Year, Total Depth, Sample Depth, Start Date
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...1`


Warning in getData(): NAs introduced by coercion


(code) view unique parameters
# print unique values in `Parameter` column
unique_parameters <- unique(data$Parameter)
print(unique_parameters)


 [1] "Chlorophyll a"            "Ammonium (N)"            
 [3] "Nitrate-Nitrite (N)"      "Nitrite (N)"             
 [5] "Nitrate (N)"              "Orthophosphate (P)"      
 [7] "Silica"                   "Nitrogen- Total"         
 [9] "Nitrogen- Total Kjeldahl" "Phosphorus- Total"       
[11] "Turbidity"               


(code) view unique parameters
# NOTE: this ran for 20min and never finished
# # create a violin plot of `Value` grouped by each `Parameter`
# ggplot2::ggplot(df, aes(x=Parameter, y=Value)) +
#     geom_violin(trim=FALSE) +
#     theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1)) +
#     labs(title="Violin Plot of Values by Parameter",
#          x="Parameter",
#          y="Value")


Render a report for each parameter:

(code) view wq report links
for (wq_param in unique_parameters) {
  # NOTE: this line is copied from last loop
  filepath = paste("parameter_report_", wq_param, ".html", sep = "")

  print(glue::glue("* [{filepath}](./{filepath}) \n"))
}


parameter_report_Chlorophyll a.html
parameter_report_Ammonium (N).html
parameter_report_Nitrate-Nitrite (N).html
parameter_report_Nitrite (N).html
parameter_report_Nitrate (N).html
parameter_report_Orthophosphate (P).html
parameter_report_Silica.html
parameter_report_Nitrogen- Total.html
parameter_report_Nitrogen- Total Kjeldahl.html
parameter_report_Phosphorus- Total.html
parameter_report_Turbidity.html

title: Sites Report
text:

if (!requireNamespace("librarian", quietly = TRUE)) {
  # If not installed, install the package
  install.packages("librarian")
}

# librarian::shelf(

source("R/getData.R")



Sites
A summary of which sites meet quality assessment checks to be included in the final map.

df <- getData()

title: Dep-wq-data-report
text:
Data files overview:


(code) import libraries & functions
if (!requireNamespace("librarian", quietly = TRUE)) {
  # If not installed, install the package
  install.packages("librarian")
}

librarian::shelf(
  readr,
  skimr,
  glue,
  ggplot2,
  quarto
)
source("R/getData.R")


There are three relevant types of data file provided:


(code) preview the raw data
inspectData <- function(fpath){
  print(fpath)
  df <- readr::read_csv(fpath)
  print(head(df))
}

inspectData("data/Merged_chla.csv")


[1] "data/Merged_chla.csv"


Rows: 60719 Columns: 9
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): Source, Site, Parameter, Units
dbl (3): Month, Year, Value
lgl (2): Total Depth, Sample Depth

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


# A tibble: 6 × 9
  Source Site  Month  Year Parameter Value Units `Total Depth` `Sample Depth`
  <chr>  <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <chr> <lgl>         <lgl>         
1 AOML   1         1  1998 chla      1.00  ug/L  NA            NA            
2 AOML   2         1  1998 chla      0.556 ug/L  NA            NA            
3 AOML   3         1  1998 chla      0.695 ug/L  NA            NA            
4 AOML   4         1  1998 chla      0.427 ug/L  NA            NA            
5 AOML   5         1  1998 chla      0.665 ug/L  NA            NA            
6 AOML   6         1  1998 chla      0.267 ug/L  NA            NA

inspectData("data/station_sampling_periods_for_all_programs.csv")

inspectData("data/Unified_WQ_Database_1995-2022.csv")

1     1 AOML   1     25.64330 -80.12670     1  1998 Chlorophyll a 1.00488  ug/L 
2     2 AOML   2     25.64330 -80.10500     1  1998 Chlorophyll a 0.555864 ug/L 
3     3 AOML   3     25.63830 -80.08330     1  1998 Chlorophyll a 0.695148 ug/L 
4     4 AOML   4     25.10830 -80.38000     1  1998 Chlorophyll a 0.426756 ug/L

6     6 AOML   6     25.06330 -80.31500     1  1998 Chlorophyll a 0.26712  ug/L 
# ℹ 6 more variables: `Total Depth` <dbl>, `Sample Depth` <dbl>,
#   `Trend Analysis` <chr>, Continuous <chr>, `Start Date` <dbl>,
#   `End Date` <chr>


Here is a summarizing table of what I see in each:









filename
geospatial info
dt info





Merged_*.csv
depth?+source+site
MM-YYYY



station_sampling_periods_for_all_programs.csv
lat+lon+source+site

start+end year + still sampling


Unified_WQ_Database_1995-2022.csv
lat+lon+source+site
MM-YYYY
start+end + still sampling



So… in theory Unified_WQ_Database_1995-2022.csv contains everything we could need.


Exploratory analyses

The Value is reading in as “Character” when it should be “Numeric”. We can convert it and view the rows that are being lost because they read as non-numeric:


(code) view bad rows
data <- getData()  # the getData in getData.R reads and converts the Value col 


New names:
Rows: 612830 Columns: 16
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(10): Source, Site, Latitude, Longitude, Parameter, Value, Units, Trend ... dbl
(6): ...1, Month, Year, Total Depth, Sample Depth, Start Date
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...1`


Warning in getData(): NAs introduced by coercion


(code) view bad rows
na_rows <- is.na(data$Value) & !is.na(data$Value_orig)
na_introduced_rows <- data[na_rows, ]

print(na_introduced_rows)


# A tibble: 4,989 × 17

#   `Trend Analysis` <chr>, Continuous <chr>, `Start Date` <dbl>,

The unique problem values in the “Values” column:


(code) view bad Value values
print(unique(na_introduced_rows$Value_orig))


[1] "Spilled"       "TRUE"          "FALSE"         "*Non-detect"  
[5] "*Not Reported" "ND"
